title: PTI slams govt’s silence over violation of Gaza truce - Pakistan - DAWN.COM
content:
ISLAMABAD: The Pak­­istan Tehreek-i-Insaf (PTI) has lambasted the government for its silence over Israel’s massacre of Palestinians even after sig­­ning of the “peace plan”, warning it against becoming part of “any conspiracy, military action, or al­liance” targeting a Muslim country.

In a statement released on Saturday, the party ex­­pressed concern over the government’s silence on violation of the Gaza ceasefire accord.

The PTI wondered whe­ther the government had raised its voice at any int­ernational forum against Israel’s aggression against Palestinians, urging the ru­­lers to jolt the consci­en­­ce of “peace guarantors”.

Regarding US President Donald Trump’s re­­marks that ‘fri­endly countries’ will send troops to Gaza, the PTI said Pakistan’s participation in any such plan or alliance would be against its national interest.

Published in Dawn, October 19th, 2025
